author: hwright
msg: (bump_to_15): #if out this function, since we're not currently using it, and

author: pburba
msg: Remove svn_wc_entry_t * argument from svn_client__get_wc_mergeinfo() and let
the entry-free goodness flow to it its many callers.
This wc-ng conversion is fairly straightforward except for one thing: Can an
added node (no base revision) inherit mergeinfo from its nearest parent with
a base revision and explicit mergeinfo?  For now we are saying yes, because
that is what all the callers of svn_client__get_wc_mergeinfo() expect and
that is what they were getting prior to this change.
node's inheritance in doc string, take an absolute WC path instead of an
entry, make output path argument absolute, and use the two pool paradigm.
(record_skips): Remove svn_wc_entry_t * argument and update call to
update calls to record_skips() and update_wc_mergeinfo().

author: rhuijben
msg: Following up on r39958, move 2 deprecated path functions to deprecated.c and
update test results for a small change in results on Windows.
The change in result on Windows allows old code using svn_path_canonicalize()/
svn_path_internal_style() to produce canonical dirents after the drive letter
(svn_path_canonicalize): New function; wrapper around uri/dirent support.
(svn_path_is_canonical): New function wrapper around uri/dirent support.
svn_path_local_style): Remove functions. These functions were
test_path_internal_style): Expect upper case driveletters on Windows.

in path.c, which was committed in r39959.]
